_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Four qualities that cast someone down to: They say they’ve seen something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve heard something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve thought something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve known something, but they haven’t.
Four qualities that raise someone up to: They say they haven’t seen something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t heard something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t thought something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t known something, and they haven’t.
